edu.stanford.pigir.arcspread

Class ArcClassifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.classify.ColumnDataClassifier
      • edu.stanford.pigir.arcspread.ArcClassifier

  • public class ArcClassifier
extends edu.stanford.nlp.classify.ColumnDataClassifier
    Wrapper around Stanford classifier. Simple workflow:
    • Turn in text to no-tab, no-newline string.
      ArcClassifier.textFilePrep(inFile, outFile)
    • Create an instance of ArcClassifier, and either (a) train it, or (b) have it load a classifier your trained before: myClassifier = new ArcClassifier(propFilePath);
      (a) myClassifier.train(trainingFile);
      (b) myClassifier.loadClassifier(classifierFile);
    • Optional, but recommended: test the classifier with a training set: myClassifier.test(testFile);
    • Classify new data:
      myClassifier.classify(inFile, outFile)
    • Optionally save your classifier:
      myClassifier.saveClassifier(outFile)
    This module is usually imported, and used programmatically, not run on the command line. The main() method is for testing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArcClassifier

        public ArcClassifier(String propertiesFileResourcePath)
        The properties file are instructions for the classifier. For this constructor the path specification is a Maven resource path. You place the property file into /src/main/resources. A file myProps.prop would be specified as "myProps.prop" in this constructor.
        Parameters:
        propertiesFileResourcePath - Maven resource path for the property file. This path is relative to /target/classes. That is where the compilation process copies files from /src/main/resources.
        See Also:
        http://www-nlp.stanford.edu/wiki/Software/Classifier

      • ArcClassifier

        public ArcClassifier(File propertiesFile)
        Constructor taking an absolute path to the property file. For property file information,
        Parameters:
        propertiesFile - File object containing the full path to the property file.
        See Also:
        http://www-nlp.stanford.edu/wiki/Software/Classifier

    • Method Detail

      • textFilePrep

        public static void textFilePrep(String inFilePath,
                String outFilePath)
                         throws IOException
        Turn a normal text file into a string of tokens without tabs. This format is required for inputs to the trained classifier.
        Parameters:
        inFilePath - absolute path to the text file.
        outFilePath - absolute path to the new file's destination.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • train

        public void train(String trainingSetResourcePath)
           throws IOException
        Train the classifier using a training file. For details on the training file format see the example cheese2007.train in this project's resources directory. The path for this method's parameter is a Maven resource path. See header comment to one of the initializers for details.
        Parameters:
        trainingSetResourcePath - resource path to the training file. Example: "myFile.train" for files in your project's /src/main/resources directory.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • train

        Parameters:
        trainingSetFile - trainingSetResourcePath resource path to the training file. Example: "myFile.train" for files in your project's /src/main/resources directory.

        IOException

      • loadClassifier

        public void loadClassifier(String resourcePath)
                    throws IOException
        In a new instance of this class: restore a classifier that was previously trained, and then saved via method saveClassifier(). The path for this method's parameter is a Maven resource path. See header comment to one of the initializers for details.
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - resource path to the saved classifier. Example: "myFile.classifier" for files in your project's /src/main/resources directory.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • loadClassifier

        public void loadClassifier(File sourceFile)
                    throws IOException
        In a new instance of this class: restore a classifier that was previously trained, and then saved via method saveClassifier(). The path for this method's parameter is absolute.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - File object with the absolute path to the saved classifier file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getFilePath

        public static String getFilePath(String resourcePath)
        Given a 'resource path', return the corresponding absolute file name. In Maven the resourcePath is relative to resource root. That is /target/classes, where resources are copied from src/main/resources during compilation.
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - Path relative to the resource root. Like /myResource.txt
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the file on this machine, or null if not found.
